message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.RO, cs.CV 

The paper focuses on applying biological memory transfer to AI systems to improve their performance throughout their lifetime experience. This involves leveraging current understanding of memory consolidation and replay algorithms. The paper specifically proposes the use of generative memory for lifelong reinforcement learning, which falls under the categories of machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE), robotics (cs.RO), and computer vision (cs.CV).
